item.title: Globbing and Regex
item.description: Globbing The asterisk means “zero or more characters” in the file glob. Lists all files ending in .md. ls *.md Lists all files starting with A and ending with .md. ls A*.md The question mark means a single unknown character. Will list All.md but won’t list About.md or A.md. ls A??.md Where Globbing and Regex Overlap Sometimes the shell will interpret regex and globbing and globbing as regex because they have syntax overlap.

item.title: Sequence Analysis
item.description: The human genome is 3.3 billion base pairs long. 75% of RNA-Seq sequences will be ribosomal. Replicates Technical replicate: sequence same sample 2x NGS technical replicates are usually 97% matching or better Biological replicate: different individual sequenced under same conditions Reference Genomes 2 major verisons GRCh NIH Genome Reference Consortium Latest release is GRCh38 UCSC Latest release is hg38 Previous release was hg19 After hg19 they decided to jump release number to match GRCh Decoy Genomes When you sequence a human genome, you dont just get human DNA.

item.title: Trace Ancestry Through DNA
item.description: Method 1: BioJulia’s GeneticVariation.jl https://github.com/BioJulia/GeneticVariation.jl/blob/master/docs/src/man/io/vcf-bcf.md BioJulia is an open source project / organization that makes biology tools with Julia. They are actively maintaining many of their repositories. However GeneticVariation.jl has less commit and hasnt been updated much in the last two years. It only has 20 stars and is overall not a very active project. However, it seems to work. But … They are query in a very manual way. THey didnt rea the vcf into a dataframe, or create an index.

item.title: Trace Ancestry Through DNA
item.description: Ever since the human genome was sequenced in 2000, we have been trying to use it to figure out where we came from. However, this field is at the intersection of society-wide misunderstandings about race / ethnicity, all the problems that come with a new technology (genome sequencing), and a public shortage of sequencing data for diverse human genomes. The obstacles between us and the “truth” about our genetic heritage are currenlty great.

Assuming that the reference genome is not a true human average (or even if it is) it must contain mutations that are causing a significant portion of humans problems (or at least a phenotype that makes a difference in daily life) that we aren’t paying attention to because they’re defined as “reference”, right?
